**ROLLEN SOM IT-KONSULT**
  


 Efter utbildningen kommer du att bli anställd som IT-konsult genom Academic Work och arbeta på uppdrag hos Academic Works kunder, i detta fall Accenture. Med din kompetens inom SAP och som IT konsult kan däremot, beroende på behov hos slutkund, befattningar, företag och storleken på potentiella uppdragsgivare att variera och det är viktigt att du i rollen som konsult är öppen för det.
 


  

  

**PRAKTISK INFORMATION**
  

  
* I denna process kommer utdrag ur belastningsregister från Polismyndigheten begäras i ett slutskede.
  
* Rekryteringsprocessen: Vi arbetar utifrån löpande urval och processen består av både tester och totalt tre intervjuer. Öka därför dina chanser att få en plats genom att söka så snart som möjligt!
  
* Sök till Academy genom att klicka på ”Ansök här på annan site” och klicka sedan på ”Utför testet” överst på landningssidan.
  
* Har du specifika frågor kring Academy och utbildningen besvaras dessa på vår Academymail under kontorstid. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mailen.
  

  


**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Helena Frykholm eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på helena.frykholm@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105481

title: Teknisk Konsult & Utvecklare inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
description:
Jobbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du intresserad av att arbeta på
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats 2023** 
 utsett av Great Place to Work? Som blivit utsedda till
 **Karriärföretag** 
 flera år i rad och som av Gartner rankas till ett
 **topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation?** 
 Då är IT-konsult och managementbolaget Sopra Steria en plats för dig. Som medarbetare på Sopra Steria blir du en del av kulturen ”Tillsammans når vi längre” och får arbeta tillsammans med ett genuint, nyfiket och drivet team. Vi tror på Power of Sharing och arbetar ständigt med att dela med oss av våra kunskaper mellan varandra och till samhället i stort. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget. I Sverige är vi idag ca 600 kollegor och i den globala koncernen är vi hela 60 000 medarbetare fördelat över 30 länder och kan vara med att påverka digitaliseringens framfart på riktigt!
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som Teknisk Konsult & Utvecklare kommer du att jobba med tekniska utmaningar i projekt där du är en del av ett kundteam från oss på Sopra Steria. Du kommer bland annat att vara ansvarig för att ta fram anpassningar/modifikationer i våra projekt, sätta upp miljöer och infrastruktur samt vara teamets tekniska guru. Med dina ambitioner och vårt kunniga och stödjande team kommer du att få fortsätta bygga ny erfarenhet och lära dig nya tekniker i projekt. Dessutom har du möjlighet att forma vilken roll du vill ha i projektet. Du kommer även att få förutsättningar att kunna utvecklas mot att till exempel bli en integrationsexpert, teknisk arkitekt eller development lead, där du kan forma rollen utifrån dina intressen och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi jobbar med spännande projekt hos ett antal kunder inom flera branscher såsom retail, tjänstesektorn, livsmedels- och fastighetsbranschen samt producerande företag. Teknikerna vi jobbar med bygger på Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance och Azure, och vi är ledande inom Power Platform där vi levererar hos flera kunder och har fortsatt många kunder som efterfrågar våra lösningar. Om du går igång på att bygga kompetens inom alla dessa plattformar och att nyttja tekniken på nya sätt, så kommer du nog trivas hos oss.
   

  

 I denna roll blir du en del i vårt Business Applications team som idag består av 70-tal medarbetare och är en blandning av applikationskonsulter, systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekter, kravanalytiker etc.
   

  

**Mer konkret…**
 …kommer du involveras i flertalet spännande projekt för att utföra:
   

  

* Verksamhetsdialog
* Förstudier och workshops
* Processkartläggning
* Utveckling affärssystemet Microsoft Dynamics Finance
* Testning
* Kunskapsdelning internt och externt


**Vem är du?**
 Kanske är du den som oftast grottar ner dig i kluriga problem, men skulle vilja lägga mer tid på att designa lösningar med den senaste tekniken. Det är viktigt för dig att leverera hållbara lösningar som du kan vara stolt över. Vi tror dessutom att du tycker att det är kul att göra leveranser i team och gärna bollar dina idéer med andra.
   

  

**Erfarenheter**
* Akademisk utbildning samt erfarenhet från konsultrollen
* Minst 5-års arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i/implementera Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
* Djup förståelse kring Microsofts ekosystem
* Visual Studio
* X+++
* Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance eller tidigare versioner av Dynamics AX
* Meriterande om du har en eller ett par certifikat inom relevanta områden
* Du bör ha haft nära dialog med interna och externa parter


 Det finns viss möjlighet till arbete på distans och beroende på var du bor så kommer du att tillhöra något av våra kontor i Östersund, Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Christer Söderholm, [email protected]
   

  

**Ansök**
 Ansök och bli en del av ett företag i digital framkant - som tror på sina medarbetare och där värdeorden driv, hjärta, nyfikenhet och kundfokus är på riktigt och genomsyrar vardagen.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

Dessutom har du möjlighet att forma vilken roll du vill ha i projektet. Du kommer även att få förutsättningar att kunna utvecklas mot att till exempel bli en integrationsexpert, teknisk arkitekt eller development lead, där du kan forma rollen utifrån dina intressen och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi jobbar med spännande projekt hos ett antal kunder inom flera branscher såsom retail, tjänstesektorn, livsmedels- och fastighetsbranschen samt producerande företag. Teknikerna vi jobbar med bygger på Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance och Azure, och vi är ledande inom Power Platform där vi levererar hos flera kunder och har fortsatt många kunder som efterfrågar våra lösningar. Om du går igång på att bygga kompetens inom alla dessa plattformar och att nyttja tekniken på nya sätt, så kommer du nog trivas hos oss.
   

  

 I denna roll blir du en del i vårt Business Applications team som idag består av 70-tal medarbetare och är en blandning av applikationskonsulter, systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekter, kravanalytiker etc.
   

  

**Mer konkret…**
 …kommer du involveras i flertalet spännande projekt för att utföra:
   

  

* Verksamhetsdialog
* Förstudier och workshops
* Processkartläggning
* Utveckling affärssystemet Microsoft Dynamics Finance
* Testning
* Kunskapsdelning internt och externt


**Vem är du?**
 Kanske är du den som oftast grottar ner dig i kluriga problem, men skulle vilja lägga mer tid på att designa lösningar med den senaste tekniken. Det är viktigt för dig att leverera hållbara lösningar som du kan vara stolt över. Vi tror dessutom att du tycker att det är kul att göra leveranser i team och gärna bollar dina idéer med andra.
   

  

**Erfarenheter**
* Akademisk utbildning samt erfarenhet från konsultrollen
* Minst 5-års arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i/implementera Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
* Djup förståelse kring Microsofts ekosystem
* Visual Studio
* X+++
* Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance eller tidigare versioner av Dynamics AX
* Meriterande om du har en eller ett par certifikat inom relevanta områden
* Du bör ha haft nära dialog med interna och externa parter


 Det finns viss möjlighet till arbete på distans och beroende på var du bor så kommer du att tillhöra något av våra kontor i Östersund, Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Christer Söderholm, [email protected]
   

  

**Ansök**
 Ansök och bli en del av ett företag i digital framkant - som tror på sina medarbetare och där värdeorden driv, hjärta, nyfikenhet och kundfokus är på riktigt och genomsyrar vardagen.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Dynamics 365 CE Consultant
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 At Avanade, we see how the power of Dynamics 365 shapes the future of businesses every day. By combining our unmatched Microsoft knowledge with our creative approach to innovation and strong industry knowledge, we create a lot of opportunities for Microsoft, our clients, and for you. Avanade has countless paths for you to pursue. One of them is sure to lead to your unique version of success.
   

  

**Come join us**
 As a Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant, you will be client-facing and responsible for the discovery, scoping, and collection of requirements to build and deploy solutions that are tailored to your customer. You will be a part of the Nordics CE (Customer Engagement) practice that consists of around 60 members in different roles as Solution Architects, Business Analysts, Developers, and Functional Consultants. We primarily work with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform and often collaborate with other practices, especially with Data & AI and Software Engineering. We have flexible work arrangements so you can work either from home or at Avanade's or our clients offices.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Experience working as a Technical CRM Consultant
* Hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform (e.g., Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI and Power Virtual Agents)
* Technical experience and/or ability to configure and customize Dynamics 365 modules (e.g., CE, Sales and/or Customer Service. Having Field Service experience is a plus)
* Experience working with no-code/low-code development
* Great interpersonal skills and experience in customer-facing roles
* Fluent in any Scandinavian language and English


**This Will Help You Stand Out**
* Programming skills and understanding of JavaScript, C# and the .NET-framework
* Relevant Dynamics 365 CE/CRM and/or Power Platform certifications
* Experience leading project teams on a day-to-day basis with expertise, guidance and mentorship
* Bachelor's or master's degree in the field of IT such as Computer Science, Information Systems, E-Business or similar


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Client-centric attitude
* Passion for learning and development


**What You'll Do**
* Consult and advise our clients and internal stakeholders on uses of technology to solve business problems
* Participate in client workshops to analyze and design solutions
* Collaborate with project teams in customizing, developing and extending Dynamics 365 CE and utilize the Power Platform to meet client needs
* Actively participating across all project phases (e.g., plan, analyze, design, build and test)
* Demonstrating a commitment to your professional development by actively obtaining relevant Power Platform (e.g., PL-200) and Dynamics CRM certifications
* Depending on your seniority, you may lead project teams with expertise and guidance


**Learn more**
 Interested to hear more? Apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Pathway to work on industry leading programs of work
* Opportunity to work with global customers
* A people-first culture that supports innovation to push teams in new directions
* Quickly turn your ideas to human impact by cultivating a team that will help clients unlock what’s next
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally


**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

title: Sales Executive
description:
Midagon är en stabil, växande koncern med mångåriga kundrelationer. Vi är över 200 konsulter i Norden, varav cirka 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer. Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom bland annat projektledning, verksamhetsutveckling, arkitektur och andra specifika ämnesområden. Vi är stolta över våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), certifierade av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Våra värdeord är Client success, Together och Quality of life. Hos oss står kunden alltid i fokus där vi tillsammans jobbar för Kunden och vår egen utveckling, där en sund livsbalans är en självklarhet.
 



  





 Vill du också vara med på en tillväxtresa där du har möjlighet att utveckla dig själv, våra medarbetare och vår framtida affär?
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Som Sales Executive hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva vår försäljning och skapa långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter, utveckla strategiska samt operativa försäljningsplaner, utveckla kontakt med befintliga kunder och uppnå försäljningsmål. Genom att förstå kundernas behov och gemensamt designa strategier för kundens IT- & affärstransformationer kommer du att bidra till företagets vision och mål.
 



  





 Vi har fina kontor både i Stockholm och Örebro och vi arbetar med kunder och personal i hela Mälardalsregionen samt Stockholm. Denna roll är baserad på Stockholmskontoret där fokus främst kommer ligga, även om interaktioner kommer ske med hela Midagons kontaktnätverk.
 



  





**Den vi söker** 




 Som person ser vi att du är en driven och målinriktad person med ett par års erfarenhet på IT-konsultmarknaden och flertalet år inom säljande roller.
 



 Vi tror också att du har:
 



  





 · Erfarenhet av B2B försäljning mot stora svenska och internationella aktörer
 



 · Förståelse inom IT-transformationer, digitalisering och strategisk IT utveckling i verksamheter
 



 · Att arbete mot säljbudget med både korta och långsiktiga mål
 



 · Vana att arbeta med CEO´s, CFO´s och liknande roller
 



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs mer på www.midagon.com där du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Hanna Fredriksson på Hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com, 076–00 74 551 och Martin Nilsson på martin.nilsson@midagon.com, 070-22 57 833.
 



  





 Välkommen till oss!

title: Biståndshandläggare till socialpsykiatrin, Enheten för Vuxna
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Bromma stadsdelsförvaltning erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där dina insatser verkligen kan göra skillnad och bidrar till samhällsnyttan i en växande stadsdel. Här är aktivt medarbetarskap och tydligt ledarskap grunden för en utvecklande verksamhet.
   

  

**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
 Avdelning Socialtjänst och fritid svarar för stadsdelens Individ- och familjeomsorg, fält, fritid och prevention samt myndighet och utförare. Vi arbetar för en sammanhållen socialtjänst.
   

  

 Enheten för vuxna vid Bromma stadsdelsförvaltning är en beställarenhet med ca 30 medarbetare uppdelade på två grupper med vardera biträdande enhetschef som leder och fördelar arbetet. Den ena gruppen arbetar med barn och vuxna med funktionsnedsättning och den andra gruppen arbetar med vuxna personer med beroendeproblematik- och socialpsykiatrins målgrupp. Enheten leds av en enhetschef och vi har två administrativa assistenter och en metodutvecklare som stöd för oss alla i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

 Gruppen beroende- och socialpsykiatri består av en Case Manager och tio handläggare varav fem på socialpsykiatri och fem på beroende som leds av en biträdande enhetschef. Socialpsykiatrin har haft ett högt inflöde av nya ärenden och har därför under hela 2024 en utökning i form av en ytterligare handläggartjänst för att säkra en god arbetsmiljö för medarbetarna och en rättssäker handläggning. Arbetsgruppen präglas av nyfikenhet och professionalitet där vi ser bemötande, samverkan och möjligheter som en naturlig del av vårt arbete. Gruppen är en trygg och erfaren arbetsgrupp som har välutvecklade arbetssätt där kollegialt stöd, humor och struktur är viktigt. Enheten för Vuxna har under 2023 utforskat nya arbetssätt för målgruppen med samsjuklighet och nyligen har hela Bromma stadsdelsförvaltning påbörjat ett två-årigt utvecklingsarbete kring aktivt medarbetarskap – det vore kul om du ville vara med på den fortsatta resan framåt! Den biträdande enhetschefen arbetar nära sin arbetsgrupp och är ett stöd i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuds du:**
 Ett varierande arbete
   

  

 Extern handledning
   

  

 Flextid
   

  

 En tillgänglig chef
   

  

 Kompetensutveckling
   

  

 Vi sitter i nybyggt aktivitetsbaserat förvaltningskontor vid Bromma blocks. Vi har ett väl utarbetat stöd från våra administrativa funktioner såsom HR, ekonomi samt våra egna assistenter och vår metodutvecklare.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som biståndshandläggare är dina arbetsuppgifter att utreda ansökningar om stöd till personer med psykisk funktionsnedsättning mellan 18-65 år och fatta beslut enligt socialtjänstlagen. Ditt arbete innebär många kontakter med olika samverkanspartners både internt och externt. Ett gott bemötande gentemot våra brukare och samarbetspartners är en självklarhet för oss.
   

  

 Som biståndshandläggare har du möjligheten att arbeta med individen i centrum. Ditt arbete som biståndshandläggare är mycket betydelsefullt och mångfacetterat då du i dialog med klienten ska arbeta för att hitta bästa lösningen för just individen i fråga. I arbetet som biståndshandläggare kan det bland annat ingå att aktualisera ärenden, utreda, göra bedömningar, fatta beslut och följa upp insatser. Ditt arbete utgår från den lagstiftning och det kunskapsstöd som finns och du arbetar utifrån en evidensbaserad praktik, dvs. att du använder de tre kunskapskällorna; brukarnas perspektiv, teoretisk kunskap och beprövade erfarenheter.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Du har
   

  

* socionomexamen.
* erfarenhet av arbete som biståndshandläggare


 Det är meriterande om har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av arbete inom myndighetsutövning.
* erfarenhet av arbete inom socialpsykiatrin,
* erfarenhet av DUR och MI.
* erfarenhet av dokumentation och handläggning i Paraplyet och/eller andra IT-baserade sociala system.


 Du är flexibel och relationsskapande, du har god förmåga att etablera kontakt med människor i en utsatt situation. Du är engagerad, professionell och har förmågan att behålla ett realistiskt perspektiv på situationer som uppstår i det dagliga arbetet som myndighetsutövare.
   

  

 Du har en mycket god samarbetsförmåga och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört sätt samt trivs med arbeta tätt med dina kollegor och att samverka med andra professioner.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande oavsett kön, könsöverskridande identitet eller uttryck, sexuell läggning, etnisk tillhörighet, religion, funktionsnedsättning eller ålder.
   

  

 Intervjuer kan ske under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Webbplats: start.stockholm
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Webbplats: start.stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Bromma | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/3542 | Kontakt: Marja-Lo Beltzikoff, Bitr. enhetschef 08-50806288, | Facklig företrädare: Kamilla Lantz, Vision 076-1206999, Marcus Sjöberg, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-50840634, | Publicerat: 2024-06-20 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-07-28

title: Solution Architect inom Microsoft Dynamics 365
description:
Jobbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du intresserad av att arbeta på
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats 2023** 
 utsett av Great Place to Work? Som blivit utsedda till
 **Karriärföretag** 
 flera år i rad och som av Gartner rankas till ett
 **topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation** 
 ? Då är IT-konsult och managementbolaget Sopra Steria en plats för dig. Som medarbetare på Sopra Steria blir du en del av kulturen ”Tillsammans når vi längre” och får arbeta tillsammans med ett genuint, nyfiket och drivet team. Vi tror på Power of Sharing och arbetar ständigt med att dela med oss av våra kunskaper mellan varandra och till samhället i stort. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget. I Sverige är vi idag ca 600 kollegor och i den globala koncernen är vi hela 60 000 medarbetare fördelat över 30 länder och kan vara med att påverka digitaliseringens framfart på riktigt!
   

  

 Nu söker vi dig som vill jobba med det världsledande affärssystemet
 **Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance** 
 och brinner för konsultuppdraget med fokus på lösning. Som Solution Architect har du en viktig och betydande roll samt ett helhetsansvar för framtagning och design av hållbara och fantastiska lösningar. Din förmåga att översätta kundens affärsbehov till effektiva och genomförbara lösningar är en central del i arbetet och även nyckeln till framgång.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Solution Architect har du en viktig och betydande roll samt ett helhetsansvar för framtagning och design av hållbara och fantastiska lösningar. Din förmåga att översätta kundens affärsbehov till effektiva och genomförbara lösningar och funktioner är en central del i arbetet och även nyckeln till framgång.
   

  

 Med dina djupa kunskaper i Dynamics 365 Finance identifierar du möjligheter och utmaningar i affärsprocesser kopplat till system. Du definierar lösningar, planerar och organiserar workshops för kunden i olika delar av applikationen och olika processområden. Tillsammans med projektledare leder du projektteam med seniora och juniora resurser enligt de prioriteringar som behövs för att lösningen levereras i enlighet med våra best-practise och med mesta möjliga nytta för våra kunder.
   

  

 Som Solution Architect hos oss får du chansen att jobba i spännande projekt och får stora möjligheter att ta ytterligare kliv inom t.ex. ledarskap och affärsutveckling med ansvar för exempelvis metodik, erbjudanden och ett större ansvar internt på Sopra Steria. I denna roll blir du en del i vårt Business Applications team som idag består av drygt 70 kollegor och är en blandning av applikationskonsulter, systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekter, kravanalytiker etc.
   

  

**Mer konkret…**
 …kommer du involveras i flertalet spännande projekt för att utföra:
   

  

* Verksamhetsdialog
* Förstudier och workshops
* Processkartläggning
* Implementation och Konfiguration av affärssystemet Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
* Testning
* Kunskapsdelning internt och externt
* Driva våra affärer och erbjudanden


**Erfarenheter**
* Akademisk utbildning samt erfarenhet från konsultrollen
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av att jobba i/implementera Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
* Djup förståelse kring verksamhetsprocesser samt Microsofts ekosystem och lösningar
* Du har gärna arbetat med Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse och andra kringliggande tjänster inom området.
* Meriterande om du har en eller ett par certifieringar inom relevanta områden
* Du bör ha haft nära dialog med interna och externa parter


**Ansökan**
 Det finns möjlighet till arbete på distans och beroende på var du bor så kommer du att tillhöra något av våra kontor i Östersund, Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Christer Söderholm, [email protected]
   

  

 Ansök och bli en del av ett företag i digital framkant - som tror på sina medarbetare och där värdeorden
 **driv, hjärta, nyfikenhet och kundfokus** 
 är på riktigt och genomsyrar vardagen.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Client Service Director
description:
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.* 




*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Essity, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.* 




  





*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.* 




  





**Job Description** 




  





 Are you a resilient leader with exceptional organizational skills and a strategic mind?
 



 This is a fantastic opportunity to thrive in a high-stakes environment. We seek a professional who excels under pressure, manages client interactions with confidence and precision, and brings a structured approach to complex challenges.This opportunity is a project-based position available for an initial term of 6 months. With successful project execution and depending on business needs, there is potential to extend the contract.
 



 As a Client Service Director you will be responsible for all ongoing communication in the Nordic & Baltics region for one of our main Power of One clients. This role is primarily characterized by solid knowledge and experience in project management, communication and media.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Develop and manage client communications briefs** 
 , ensuring clear expectations and deliverables for all involved, with particular attention to project scopes and milestones.
* **Design and oversee detailed project timelines** 
 , actively managing and adjusting schedules to optimize workflow and ensure project deliverables meet client expectations and deadlines.
* **Maintain and deepen client relationships** 
 through regular updates and meetings, effectively managing expectations while being attuned tolong-term goals and immediate project needs.
* **Lead the project planning process** 
 , converting client business objectives into actionable project plans and schedules that align with broaderstrategies.
* **Coordinate project teams and resources across several markets** 
 , ensuring optimal allocation for efficient campaign execution, and providing detailed reports and conducting thorough follow-ups.
* **Manage all project contractual aspects** 
 , including scope agreements, billing, and compliance with client agreements, ensuring clear documentation and adherence to terms throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Direct project budget management and profitability analysis** 
 , ensuring that all projects are delivered within budget and meet financial targets, including the tracking of expenditures and media spend.
* **Facilitate strategic project reviews and proactive discussions** 
 about client growth opportunities, analyzing project outcomes to inform future engagements and business development efforts.
* **Manage project management - and financetools** 
 ,to meet project milestones and successful campaign delivery.
* **Serve as the primary point of escalation for project issues** 
 , solving problems efficiently and proactively to maintain project momentum and client satisfaction.



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 In order to thrive in this role we believe that you have a minimum of 5 years working experience from the media and communications industry. You have track record from successfully leading and building strong relationships with clients to develop and grow their business. We place high value on your ability to work in a structured manner with an optimistic, solution-oriented, and upbeat attitude.
 



  





 In addition to this we are looking for someone who...
 



  




* Is ensuring first class deliveries that meet the quality, commitment, and service level of the client
* Is confident and experienced in leading the customer's strategic planning process based on their business objectives and translating them into clear, comprehensive communication and media recommendations
* Takes ownership and manages the process from client brief to campaign start, having overall budget responsibility and ensuring that KPIs are met
* Is able to work both strategically and operatively in a fast-paced environment.
* Has excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills
* Is a skilled self-leader with the ability to successfully lead and support a cross market team and client
* Boasts a genuine sense of business as well as a deep understanding of the media industry. Digital knowledge is meritorious
* Is proactive, daring, engaged and responsible. Values collaboration and has a collective mindset
* Experienced in engaging and coordinating with multiple international stakeholders
* Is a great problem solver that is resilient to stressful situations under pressure and with tight deadlines, able to identify possibilities and adapting easily to change with an open mindset and positive approach
* Has a “can-do” attitude and will easily roll up your sleeves to deliver on goals and plans.
* Communicates clearly and is fluent in both Swedish and English



  





**Additional Information** 




  





 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
 


* **Career Opportunities**



 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
 


* **Personal and Professional Learning**



 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
 


* **Flexible Ways of Working**



 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
 


* **Work Your World**



 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
 


* **Mental Health**



 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
 


* **Benefits**



 Generous benefit package.
 



  





 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Product Analyst | Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a dedicated and creative Senior Product Analyst interested in pushing our topline performance as a part of the Candy Crush Saga In-App Purchase & Economy area. You will get the opportunity to be part of a great team, working with an industry leading and genre defining game with over 200 million active players.
   

  

 Your role within the Kingdom
   

  

 As a Senior Product Analyst focusing on our In-App Purchases, you will partner with product managers, product analysts, and data scientists (among others) to improve performance of the monetization in Candy Crush from a business, strategy, and product perspective. You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include
   

  

* Perform quantitative & qualitative analyses to identify product and monetization opportunities for Candy Crush Saga in-app purchases
* Design in-game experiments and perform AB-tests to validate product opportunity hypotheses and improve business outcomes
* Partner with product managers to drive ad-hoc analytical and strategic workstreams to drive step-changes in in-app purchases performance, such as pricing strategy
* Communicate results of your analysis in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualization and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sources
* Define best practices, new KPIs and inquisitive processes for reporting on our progress to the rest of the immediate team and fellow Candy Crushers


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

 You are a passionate problem solver with both a commercial and analytical skill set and experience driving workstreams independently. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced and collaborative environment whilst communicating efficiently with teams and individuals across King.
   

  

****Who you are****
* You have experience from a business role (strategy, management consulting, pricing, etc.) focused on topline improvements in a B2C environment, and an analytical skill set with a passion for data-driven decision making
* You have knowledge about key pricing and commercial methods and techniques
* You are experienced with driving workstreams independently and approaching abstract business and strategy problems
* You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and work in a fast paced and collaborative environment
* Effective communicator with a shown ability to get analytical insights across to teams and individuals
* You have an interest in product and games development
* You are confident in SQL and data extraction and likely know Python, R or similar
* Masters’ or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience.


* Work experience in the mobile gaming industry or similar


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Supply Chain Consultant
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 Join our Nordic ERP team of talented professionals and contribute with your expertise to help organizations achieve operational excellence and drive successful digital transformations using Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP. We partner with some of the biggest companies across the world, working together to improve business outcomes. We help not only well-established organizations move into the digital era, but also support innovative start-ups as they build their businesses.
   

  

**We**
* Have a wide variety of interesting projects to work with both locally and globally
* Provide you with a dedicated Career Adviser to support you during your journey at Avanade and who works together with you to create a personal development plan
* Welcome you to a team of engaged and helpful co-workers
* Have a wide range of different benefits such as employee stock purchasing, flexible work arrangements, a commitment to diversity and inclusion
* Provide the opportunity to work for Microsoft's Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 tears in a row), with a wide variety of development and training opportunities (80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Have offices in the major Nordic cities, and we support flexible work locations.


**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work for the Microsoft 1 Partner, with an unrivalled focus on development, global opportunities as well as a dedicated career advisor to support you through your career progression.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Strong consulting skills and client-facing experience with an implementation partner
* You have a passion for learning along with good business sense and time management
* You know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively
* You’ve likely achieved a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field
* At least one full-cycle implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or Dynamics AX OR experience supporting Dynamics 365 F&O as a strong user within the Supply Chain modules
* Experience with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module
* Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain Management end-user experience nice to have but not required
* Experience managing/leading teams both on and offshore is nice to have, but not required


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 You will:
   

  

* Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements
* Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O) to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to
* Run workshops with your clients, consultants, and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping
* Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions
* Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements
* Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system
* Support testing the proposed system and train users


**Learn more**
**Apply today!**
 To Learn more about Avanade Nordics, visit our home page.
   

  

 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Legal Counsel
description:
**About Brite**
 Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants. Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction.
   

  

 The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges. Now we channel all those experiences into developing modern solutions that will benefit both merchants and end-users.
   

  

 Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Brite is growing rapidly, and so is also Brite’s legal team. You will be a crucial part to the legal team with your focus on commercial relationships and corporate housekeeping. Most of your time will be dedicated to interacting with Brite’s sales and finance departments as well as being in close contact with external law firms and advisors ensuring an efficient collaboration between legal and other stakeholders. You will provide support across the whole business on a range of legal issues relevant to a high-growth, innovative, scale-up business within payments. You will however mostly focus on:
   

  

* Negotiate, draft and advise on a variety of commercial agreements, including customer, supplier and partner agreements.
* Handle basic corporate housekeeping and administration, such as draft of board minutes and manage filings with various authoritiesas as well as suppling the organisation with corporate documents.


**Are you a brite mind?**
 It would be great if you are an individual who ask yourself “Can we do it this in another way?”, “What’s best for Brite?“, and “Can I express myself in another way to get my message through?”. We want you to be diligent and mindful of details, but bold enough to take on new legal areas.
   

  

 Required skills:
   

  

* European law degree
* 3+ years of experience from law firm, from within a corporate in-house legal department or public authority
* Basic knowledge in contract and corporate law
* Excellent English writing and communication skills


**What We Offer**
* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards
* A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
* An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
* A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigelessness
* ... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people ✨


 Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

title: Guidewire Cloud Architect - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Lead Consultant
   

  

**Technology** 
 – Guidewire Cloud Architecture
   

  

**Location** 
 – Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of a Lead Consultant, you will anchor the engagement effort for assignments, all the way from business process consulting and problem definition to solution design, development and deployment. You will be pivotal to problem definition and discovery of the overall solution and guide teams on project processes, deliverables.
   

  

 As a thought leader in your domain, you will be the key advisor to architecture and design reviews. You will anchor business pursuit initiatives, client training, in-house capability building. You will have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.
   

  

**Required**
* 12-15 years of IT experience and 7+ years of experience in leading and solutioning Guidewire platform Implementation both On-prem and Cloud
* Experience working in all the Guidewire Centers like Policy, Billing, Claims and Contact Centers
* Working knowledge in GW Digital applications integration using Edge API, APD Tools
* Strong Understanding of GW Cloud Versions
* Experience in solutioning implementations like New Implementation, Application Development and Maintenance as well as Technical Migration/upgrade
* Need to have consulting and advisory skills to provide suggestions to customer on new Projects/initiatives, areas for improvement, best practices etc.,
* Batch process, Guidewire Messaging framework, OOTB plugins.
* Working knowledge on GOSU script, GIT – Source Code management


**Preferred**
* Git repository, Service now
* Good communication skill and should be able to adapt in Client Implementation
* Experience in Project delivery methodologies (Agile, SAFe,)
* Swedish Speaking


**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* High analytical skills
* A high degree of initiative and flexibility
* High customer orientation
* High quality awareness
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**About Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

**Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.
   

  

 All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer**

title: Sustainability Manager
description:
*Är du en engagerad och affärsdriven person med en stark passion för hållbarhetsfrågor? Avoki söker en Sustainability Manager som vill driva, ansvara och utveckla vårt hållbarhetsarbete.*
 Avoki erbjuder flexibla, säkra och hållbara IT-lösningar med fokus på hybrid arbetsplats, säkerhet, molntjänster, mötesteknik och innovation. Vi strävar efter att leverera toppmoderna fullservice-lösningar som tar företag in i framtiden, med hållbarhet som en central del av vår affärsfilosofi.
   

  

 Rollen som Sustainability Manager innebär att leda och utveckla företagets hållbarhetsstrategier och initiativ. Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i analysering och uppföljning av Avokis hållbarhetsarbete på koncernnivå.
   

  

**Det inkluderar att**
* Driva utvecklingen av hållbarhetsarbetet i hela organisationen, uppdatera strategier och mål, följa upp och rapportera framsteg
* Löpande integrera hållbarhet i affärsstrategin
* Vara del av större kundaffärer och upphandlingar där vårt hållbarhetsarbete är en viktig komponent för att vinna affärer
* Driva Avokis CSRD-arbete
* Samordna arbetet för att upprätthålla och utveckla relevanta ISO-certifieringar
* Vara en nyckelspelare för att driva hållbarhetsrapportering och transparens i värdekedjan i enlighet med lagkrav och bästa praxis inom branschen
* Involvera och öka medvetenheten om hållbarhet internt och externt


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har**
* En relevant högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, miljövetenskap eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling med fokus på hållbarhetsrapportering och projektledning
* Starka kommunikativa färdigheter och påverkansförmåga


 Den ideala kandidaten är engagerad i hållbarhetsfrågor, har förmågan att inspirera andra och är driven av att skapa positiv förändring mot en hållbar framtid.
   

  

 Avoki erbjuder en spännande möjlighet för den som vill integrera hållbarhet i affärsstrategi och ledningspraxis inom en innovativ IT-miljö. Du får möjlighet att påverka och driva företagets hållbarhetsagenda.
   

  

**Utöver detta erbjuder vi**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter inom ditt expertisområde
* Generösa förmåner så som Friskvårdstimme, Learning hour och Lunchkort
* Flexibel arbetsplats och möjlighet att arbeta remote


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

*Avoki is the result of the merger of Office Management, Bluecom and Xite. Together, we offer secure and sustainable IT solutions. Avoki is owned by Nalka Invest AB and had a turnover of 1100 MSEK in 2023. We have offices in Stockholm, Uppsala, Gothenburg, Malmö, Helsingborg, Linköping, Luleå, Kramfors, Oslo, Helsinki, and Tampere.*

title: Agile Coach
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
*Som agil coach kommer du ha en avgörande roll i att skapa en kultur av flexibilitet, samarbete och ständig förbättring hos våra kunder genom att stödja och guida dem genom agila förändringsprocesser.*
**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Agil Coach kommer du att skapa förutsättningar och inspirera till att föra ut de agila principerna i kundernas organisationer. Genom att coacha och vara en mentor till människor inom hela organisationen kommer du att vara en central del i kundens agila förflyttning. Du är uppmärksam och lyhörd inför kundens specifika behov och med din långa erfarenhet som agil coach vet du vad som krävs för att uppnå en högpresterande, kollaborativ och ständigt förbättrande kultur. Uppdragen rör sig från strategisk nivå med ledningsgrupper, till en nära samverkan med teamen i det dagliga arbetet. Vi tror att du har en välutvecklad anpassningsförmåga och starkt resultatfokus. Du är pragmatiskt lagd och kan anpassa metod och arbetssätt efter sammanhang för att få till stånd förflyttning, implementation och resultat.
   

  

**Om dig**
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Agil Coach och förändringsledning med agila metoder
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av IT-utveckling
* Du ses som en expert inom agila metoder och ramverk
* Van att facilitera workshops och hålla utbildningar
* Du besitter utbildning och relevanta certifieringar inom det agila området
* Vi ser gärna att du även har erfarenhet av roller som Scrum master och Product owner sedan tidigare
* Du behärskar både svenska och engelska såväl i tal som skrift


**Ansökan**
 Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV via annonsen. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller bolaget i sig är du välkommen att kontakta Marie Berg via mail: marie.berg@soprasteria.com
   

  

 Sopra Steria har kunder och projekt som kan kräva säkerhetsgodkännande på olika nivåer.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Director, Corporate Banking, Stockholm
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Job Description**
**Job Title:** 
 Director, Corporate Banking
   

  

**Corporate Title:** 
 Director
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day. One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being. Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization. Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!
   

  

**The Team**
 We are expanding our Corporate Banking team in the Nordics and are looking for a Director to join the team. In this role you will act as senior client manager for key clients across the Nordics portfolio. As well as having increasing amounts of responsibility for your relationships including targeted client additions to the portfolio you will also be involved in handling all aspects of major client relationships, including advice, direction, coordination and execution of various transactions.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a core member of the Nordics Corporate Banking team you will:
   

  

* Act as the senior client manager for key clients
* You will manage, develop and direct resources and activities across the Bank’s global franchise in order to deliver the full suite of products and services
* Originate, build and manage client relationships on a day-to-day basis and provide a point of contact
* Manage multi-product origination efforts within the integrated coverage model and ensure internal partnerships are seamless and efficient
* Originate business and offer all the products the Bank can offer to each client
* Provide market informed judgements on a broad array of financing strategies to address client specific needs
* Structure, prepare and deliver content led presentations
* Be responsible for ensuring the Bank's activities are conducted in a compliant and risk free manner
* Manage and mentor junior professionals in the context of deal executions, marketing pitches and general career development


**What We Are Looking For**
* Excellent client relationships, marketing, presentation and sales skills
* Self-motivated, tenacious and able to work with high degree of independence
* Proven track record in client management and new business origination
* Meticulous attention to detail, diligence and conscientiousness
* Ambitious, with a strong desire to succeed
* Capable of working effectively both independently and with multiple teams/individuals
* Strong mathematical and analytical skills are required
* You will have the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously & working effectively as an individual & as part of a team
* Fluency in English is essential and a second language from one of the Nordics countries would be a plus but is not required
* Experience at another US investment bank or major Nordic investment bank


**Skills That Will Help**
* A second language from one of the Nordics countries would be a plus but is not required


**Bank Of America**
 Good conduct and sound judgment is crucial to our long term success. It’s important that all employees in the organisation understand the expected standards of conduct and how we manage conduct risk. Individual accountability and an ownership mind-set are the cornerstones of our Code of Conduct and are at the heart of managing risk well.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of sex, gender identity or gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, socio-economic background, responsibility for dependants or physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications and experience.
   

  

 We strive to ensure that our recruitment processes are accessible for all candidates and encourage any candidates to tell us about any adjustment requirements.

title: Experienced Change and Process Specialist, Group Credit Management
description:
**Job ID: 24798** 


  
 





 Group Credit Management are developing with high speed to meet demand for credit decision automation and at the same time stay compliant. Our work with development span cross the End to End Credit life cycle from the Credit risk assessment and decision, High risk processes and Reporting. To deliver on our agenda we collaborate within Group Credit Management and with all Business Areas as well as Group Credit Risk Control, Group Finance and Regulatory Reporting, Group Data management and IT.
 





  
 





 We are now looking for experienced change and process specialist with a strong interest in data within Information and Analytics capability. The position will offer an exciting opportunity for you to develop a key capability at the heart of Nordea. You will gain insight in the credit risk processes as well as how they are interlinked with the Capital and Credit risk reporting processes.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 You will join Reporting and Analytics a unit within Information and Analytics Capability that focuses on strategy, requirements, analysis, development and governance of credit risk data needed for key credit functionality and processes such as credit assessment and decision, monitoring and reporting. As an experienced Change and Process Specialist you drive functional and non-functional requirements, analysis of data and data sources to meet the requirements and UAT sign offs. You will work close with our stakeholders in GCM, 2nd LoD and business areas to understand requirements and problems, proposing solutions ad hoc as well as through our development backlogs.
 





  
 





 You will work closely with the other team members and relevant stakeholders to analyse and support the implementation of the Credit and Risk information architecture and data flows across the credit capability sub areas to fulfil the credit risk reporting for business as well as regulatory requirements.
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing** 
 :
 




* Work closely with the Product Owner and support with planning activities.
* Structure and drive analysis and requirements to successfully implement smaller or larger improvement in existing data flows and business logic for Credit risk reporting and Operational data.
* Be a part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, evaluating and prioritizing features working closely with development teams and relevant stakeholders.
* Ensuring delivered functionality meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business value.
* Building specific competence on credit processes, applications, reports and data.
* When required take roles as Product owner, Data steward as a possibility to grow
* Identify potential and actively propose improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and data.





 We are looking to expand our Nordic team.
 





  
 





 The team is Nordic with reps in different countries. You’ll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 





 We are looking for a versatile business professional having strong analytical skills, with an understanding of data and Credit risk processes. You work well with others and are flexible within your own role to support the achievements of team results, understanding your own contribution in the value chain, by sharing knowledge with colleagues and contribute to an open dialogue by being curious and attentive. You will proactively take on the responsibility to support the goal of creating great customer experiences, always acting with the customer’s needs in mind.
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you** 
 :
 




* Have relevant experience in Business Requirements elicitation and act as a liaison the change/IT organisation.
* Driven individual who can work with data sources and databases.
* Have strong analytical skills with interest in the Credit risk processes and gaining understanding of the business logic and processes underpinning the reports and operational use cases.
* Create valid decision-making proposals to superior.
* Are self-going with own contribution in the value chain by acting with the customers in mind in all processes to create great customer experiences.
* Proactively take on the responsibility to support the goal of creating great customer experiences in every relationship and delivery in order to make it possible.
* Share knowledge with colleagues and contribute to an open dialogue in the team.
* Strong communication: comfortable initiating and driving meetings with stakeholders.
* Ability to quickly learn and with an interest to develop an understanding for banking and credit.
* Work well with others and always act with the customer’s needs in mind.
* Are flexible within your own role to support the achievements of team results.
* Execute on planned tasks to ensure that targets are met.
* Demonstrable understanding of data management (governance, ownership, data definition, lineage, profiling, root cause analysis, remediation).
* High level of energy and engagement with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with tight deadlines.
* A natural “can do” attitude and a high level of curiosity to find solutions.



  
 





**Your experience and background** 
 :
 




* 5 years of relevant work experience.
* Experienced in documenting and conceptualising requirements capturing the essential in complex environments.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (SQL, Python, SAS or similar tools).
* Strong understanding of both business and IT.
* Experience working with Enterprise Datawarehouse or Data marts.
* Experience within big data analysis through Snowflake or Hadoop will be considered an advantage but not a necessity.
* Previous experience of credit management or capital reporting is a plus, but not a necessity.
* Familiar with agile methodologies is a plus.
* Working experience in Financial Services or a Consultancy is a plus.
* Fluent in English written and spoken.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 11/08/2024
 



 . Interviews will be held continuously. Please be aware that any applications coming through email will not be accepted. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Sheetal Kapur at sheetal.kapur@nordea.se or Head of Reporting & Analytics Nobin Jacob Cherian, nobin.jacob.cherian@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Sr. GTM Specialist Containers Europe North
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Description**
 Are you a customer-obsessed builder with a passion for helping customers achieve their full potential? Do you have the business savvy, Application Modernization background, and sales skills necessary to help position AWS as the cloud provider of choice for customers? Do you love building new strategic and data-driven businesses? Join the Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) Enterprise Applications Migration & Modernization team as a Business Development Specialist!
   

  

 The Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) is part of AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS), which is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. We work backwards from our customer's most complex and business critical problems to build and execute go-to-market plans that turn AWS ideas into multi-billion-dollar businesses. WWSO teams include business development, specialist and technical solutions architecture. As part of WWSO, you'll provide expertise across the entire life cycle of an AWS customer initiative, from developing ideas for new services to accelerating the adoption of established businesses. We pride ourselves on thinking big, delivering exceptional results for our customers, and working across AWS as #OneTeam.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Own the GTM strategy and execution for Containers in EMEA North, collaborating with teams in the field including Sales, Partners, Marketing, and other Specialists.
* Leverage your deep expertise in your Containers to understand the most important customer problems in your region and enable account aligned teams in the field to solve them.
* Lead cross-functional initiatives to expand markets/accounts, develop scalable programs to drive adoption, and identify new opportunities within your domain.
* Develop and execute goals to drive long term growth in your geography, while meeting/exceeding revenue and non-revenue driven KPI's.
* Bring customer data and market signals back to Worldwide teams to ensure we are prioritizing the building of the right features and services for our customers.
* Delivering monthly/quarterly business reviews and operational planning documents for your respective tech domain and geography.
* Drive geographical scale through external partners; Partner with cross functional teams across Solution Architecture, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, and Training and execute customer acquisition programs and strategies


 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Within WWSO, this position is a part of the Go-To-Market (GTM) Specialist team, where you will lead GTM strategy for AWS' Containers for EMEA North. We create sales plays, leverage partners, and build new initiatives that drive results for our customers. We provide critical feedback from customers to inform our product roadmap, and work closely with our partner network to build an ecosystem supporting our customers' goals. In emerging areas, we play a critical role as the “first in” teams to build markets for new services, domains, or solutions. When a customer needs to innovate and requires a new way to leverage AWS, they count on us to innovate with them to build and deliver what they need.
   

  

 We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

 Stockholm, SWE
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of relevant GTM, Sales, or Consulting experience
* 5+ years of technology domain experience in Containers, Serverless and Application Modernization


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills with experience communicating to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Established track record of credibility as a technology advisor with customer executives (e.g. CEO, COO, CIO, CTO, CMO) and Line of Business Leaders.
* Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners.
* Experience in a heavily matrixed sales environment, including developing, implementing, managing, and executing go-to-market growth initiatives and sales motions.
* Deep understanding of cloud technologies, including public and hybrid cloud platforms.
* Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Experienced ASIC System Architects to AXIS - Stockholm
description:
**Job Title**
 Experienced ASIC System Architects to AXIS - Stockholm
   

  

**Job Description**
*At Axis, we’ve always been about pushing the boundaries in pursuit of innovating for a smarter, safer world. We do this by developing IP-based products and innovations for security and video surveillance. This spring we will open a new R&D Office in Stockholm and we are now looking for ASIC System Architects as one competence needed to build the new ASIC team. Don´t miss the opportunity to be among the first to join our new site!*
**Who is your future team?**
 The ASIC team in Stockholm will play an important part in the development of future generations of ARTPEC SoC chips. The team will be involved in the general SoC architecture as well as specification, design, and verification of internal IPs. The team will have long term responsibility for parts of the ARTPEC SoC chip and development will be done in close collaboration with the ASIC teams in Lund. Learn more; https://newsroom.axis.com/article/artpec-foundation-quality
   

  

 Our most important asset is our ability to cooperate. If you are a person that likes to get involved, make a difference, and nudge the world a little bit in the right direction, you will feel at home with us.
   

  

 We have a highly skilled and motivated ASIC team in place in Lund with a mix of both junior and senior team members. Now we are about to expand and strengthen our ASIC development by opening a new office in Stockholm. For the new Stockholm ASIC team, we now look for an experienced ASIC Systems Architect with skills within some of the following areas:
   

  

* System architecture
* External interfaces
* Low-power architecture
* Security
* Package and PI/SI


**What You Will Do As ASIC System Architect**
 The ASIC System Architect plays an important role throughout the ASIC project and have a strong impact on the next generation of ARTPEC SoC chips. You will not only specify important system level requirements in the early phases of the project but also and participate in the implementation, manufacturing, and silicon bring-up phases to secure that the chip will fulfil all our expectations. This work is done in cooperation with many internal stakeholders and external partners, such as our ASIC vendor and IP suppliers that contributes to parts of our SoC implementation.
   

  

 Some typical areas that you will participate in as ASIC System Architect are:
   

  

* Discuss and specify SoC requirements.
